using System;

{
    public int Id { get; set; }
    public string FirstName { get; set; }
    public string LastName { get; set; }
    public string Email { get; set; }

    /// <summary>
    /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="UserDto"/> class from the specified <see cref="global::User"/>.
    /// </summary>
    /// <param name="source">The source <see cref="global::User"/> object to copy data from.</param>
    public UserDto(global::User source)
    {
        this.Id = source.Id;
        this.FirstName = source.FirstName;
        this.LastName = source.LastName;
        this.Email = source.Email;
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="UserDto"/> class with default values.
    /// </summary>

    /// This constructor is useful for unit testing, object initialization, and scenarios
    /// where you need to create an empty instance and populate properties later.
    /// </remarks>
    public UserDto()
    {
    }
